trans-unit.source: Provides design-time support in a visual designer for the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.LoginView"></xref> Web server control.

The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.LoginView> control renders one of its templates, determined by whether a user is logged on to the host Web site, and the roles that contain the logged-on user account.

In a visual designer, when you switch from Source to Design view, the markup source code that describes the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.LoginView> control is parsed and a design-time version of the control is created on the design surface.
When you switch back to Source view, the design-time control is persisted to the markup source code and edited into the markup for the Web page.
The LoginViewDesigner class provides design-time support for the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.LoginView> control.

The <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.LoginViewDesigner.ActionLists%2A> property returns a <xref:System.ComponentModel.Design.DesignerActionListCollection> object, which typically contains an object that is derived from the <xref:System.ComponentModel.Design.DesignerActionList> class for each level in the inheritance tree of the designer.

The <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.LoginViewDesigner.TemplateGroups%2A> property returns a collection of template groups for the templates of the associated <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.LoginView> control.

The <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.LoginViewDesigner.UsePreviewControl%2A> property always returns `true`, indicating that the designer creates a temporary copy of the associated <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.LoginView> control to generate the design-time markup.

The LoginViewDesigner class methods provide the following functionality: - The <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.LoginViewDesigner.GetDesignTimeHtml%2A> methods return the markup that is used to render the associated <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.LoginView> control at design time.

The <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.LoginViewDesigner.GetEmptyDesignTimeHtml%2A> method gets the markup that renders a placeholder for the associated control at design time when the current template is not defined.
The <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.LoginViewDesigner.GetErrorDesignTimeHtml%2A> method provides the markup that renders the associated control at design time when an error has occurred.

- The <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.LoginViewDesigner.GetEditableDesignerRegionContent%2A> method returns a serialized copy of the current template for the associated <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.LoginView> control.
The <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.LoginViewDesigner.SetEditableDesignerRegionContent%2A> method sets a region of the associated control from a serialized copy of a control template.
- The <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.LoginViewDesigner.Initialize%2A> method prepares the designer to view, edit, and design the associated <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.LoginView> control.
The <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.LoginViewDesigner.OnComponentChanged%2A> method is called when there is a change to the associated control.

The <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.LoginViewDesigner.PreFilterProperties%2A> method is used to remove properties from, add additional properties to, or shadow properties of the associated control.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.LoginViewDesigner"></xref> class.

The .NET Framework internally constructs a new instance of the <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.LoginViewDesigner> class when it creates the associated <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.LoginView> control or a copy of that control on the design surface.
Gets the designer action list collection for this designer.

The ActionLists property creates a <xref:System.ComponentModel.Design.DesignerActionList> object for the <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.LoginViewDesigner> class, adds it to the <xref:System.ComponentModel.Design.DesignerActionListCollection> that is obtained from the ActionLists base property, and then returns the <xref:System.ComponentModel.Design.DesignerActionListCollection>.
The <xref href="System.ComponentModel.Design.DesignerActionListCollection"></xref> associated with this designer.
Gets the markup that is used to render the associated control at design time.

The GetDesignTimeHtml method sets the template index of the associated <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.LoginView> control to the current design-time index, and then causes the associated control to recreate and data bind its child controls, if necessary.
Next, the GetDesignTimeHtml calls the <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.ControlDesigner.GetDesignTimeHtml%2A> base method to generate the markup.
A string containing the markup used to render the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.LoginView"></xref> at design time.
Gets the markup that is used to render the associated control at design time and populates a collection of designer regions.
The GetDesignTimeHtml method creates an <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.EditableDesignerRegion> object for a template editing area on the visual designer surface, and then initializes it as a template.
If no templates are defined, a string is displayed that prompts you to click to begin editing.
A predefined constant is used to generate the returned markup.

A <xref href="System.Web.UI.Design.DesignerRegionCollection"></xref> to which definitions of the selectable and clickable regions in the design-time view of the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.LoginView"></xref> are added.
A string containing the markup used to render the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.LoginView"></xref> at design time.
Returns a serialized copy of the current template that is used to render the associated control at design time.
If a template implementing the <xref:System.Web.UI.ITemplate> interface can be obtained from the `region` parameter, the GetEditableDesignerRegionContent method returns the persisted template.
Otherwise, it calls the <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.ControlDesigner.GetEditableDesignerRegionContent%2A> base method to generate the content.

The serialized template can be restored to the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.LoginView> control by using the <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.LoginViewDesigner.SetEditableDesignerRegionContent%2A> method.
The <xref href="System.Web.UI.Design.EditableDesignerRegion"></xref> for which to obtain content.
A string containing a serialized copy of the template used to render the associated <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.LoginView"></xref> at design time.
Gets the markup that renders a placeholder for the associated control at design time when the current template is not defined.

The GetEmptyDesignTimeHtml method first formats a string message that specifies the name of the current template of the associated <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.LoginView> control and also specifies that the template is empty.
Then the GetEmptyDesignTimeHtml generates the markup for a placeholder containing that message.
A string containing markup text that renders to a placeholder on the design surface.
Provides the markup that renders the associated control at design time when an error has occurred.
The error design-time <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.LoginView> control renders as a panel that contains the type name, the control name, and messages announcing and describing the error.
The <xref:System.Exception> that was thrown.
A string that contains the markup used to render the associated <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.LoginView"></xref> at design time after an error has occurred.
Prepares the designer to view, edit, and design the associated control.
The visual designer calls the Initialize method when it is ready to use the designer to render the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.LoginView> control.
The Initialize and its base methods configure properties and set up events that are necessary for the operation of the designer.
The `component` parameter is the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.LoginView> control that is associated with this designer or a copy of the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.LoginView> control.
A <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.LoginView"></xref>, which implements an <xref href="System.ComponentModel.IComponent"></xref>.
component is not a or of a class derived from .
Called when there is a change to the control that is associated with this designer.

The OnComponentChanged method is called when the <xref:System.ComponentModel.Design.IComponentChangeService.ComponentChanged> event of the associated <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.LoginView> control executes.
Typically, this is in response to a property change on the control (for example, a **Properties** grid change).
If the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.LoginView> control template is changed, the **Properties** grid is refreshed.
The OnComponentChanged verifies that the current template index is valid, and then calls the <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.ControlDesigner.OnComponentChanged%2A> base method.
The source of the event.
A <xref href="System.ComponentModel.Design.ComponentChangedEventArgs"></xref> that contains the event data.
Used by the designer to remove properties from or add properties to the display in the **Properties** grid or to shadow properties of the associated control.

Control designers use methods that are derived from the <xref:System.ComponentModel.Design.ComponentDesigner.PreFilterProperties%2A?displayProperty=fullName> method to shadow various control properties with corresponding design-time properties that the designer implements, and to add properties to or remove properties from the **Properties** grid.

The PreFilterProperties method applies the <xref:System.ComponentModel.BrowsableAttribute> attribute of the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.LoginView.RoleGroups%2A> property so that it does not appear in the **Properties** grid.
A collection implementing the <xref:System.Collections.IDictionary> of the added or shadowed properties.
Sets a region of the associated control from a serialized copy of a control template.

The SetEditableDesignerRegionContent method parses a serialized template for the associated <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.LoginView> control that is specified by the `content` parameter, and then uses the template to update the region of the control that is specified by the <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.DesignerObject.Name%2A> property of the `region` parameter.

The current template of the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.LoginView> control can be serialized using the <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.LoginViewDesigner.GetEditableDesignerRegionContent%2A> method.
An <xref href="System.Web.UI.Design.EditableDesignerRegion"></xref> that provides the name of the region to update.
A string that contains a serialized template for the associated control.
Gets a collection of template groups for the fields of the associated control.

The TemplateGroups property gets a <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.TemplateGroupCollection> object from the TemplateGroups base property, and then adds <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.TemplateGroup> objects that contain a single <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.TemplateDefinition> object for the anonymous template (which corresponds to no user logged on), for the logged-on template, and for each <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.RoleGroup> element in the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.LoginView.RoleGroups%2A> collection of the associated <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.LoginView> control to the <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.TemplateGroupCollection>.
The TemplateGroups returns this <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.TemplateGroupCollection> to the caller.
A <xref href="System.Web.UI.Design.TemplateGroupCollection"></xref> containing an element for each template in the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.LoginView"></xref> control.
Gets a value indicating whether the designer should use a temporary copy rather than the actual control that is associated with the designer to generate the design-time markup.

Because the UsePreviewControl property is always `true`, the designer <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.ControlDesigner.ViewControl%2A> property returns a copy of the associated <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.LoginView> control to generate the design-time markup.

The <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.ControlDesigner.ViewControl%2A> property creates the copy by persisting the actual <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.LoginView> control, then parsing the persisted control string.
The copied control does not affect any persistence for the actual <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.LoginView>.

If the UsePreviewControl property has been overridden to return `false`, the designer will use the associated <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.LoginView> control itself to generate the design-time markup, and design-time changes to the control will persist to the page markup source.
Always <xref uid="langword_csharp_true" name="true" href=""></xref>.
